title: Transfer fail from S3 to Google Storage - Corrupted on transfer: md5sums differ
body:
Just checking out the rclone application for the first time today to mirror some AWS S3 bucket to Google Cloud Storage and came across issues with larger files not transferring over with the following error - Corrupted on transfer: md5sums differ

I tried on a couple of source S3 buckets today and had the same issue - small files seemed to transfer OK but larger files kept giving this md5sums differ error.

Is there a configuration option I missed or a new issue?

Thanks
Jim

Sample log:
root@Automation:~/rclone-v1.12-linux-amd64# ./rclone sync AWS-S3:db-backups Google-Storage-Test:testoffsitestorage -v

2015/05/07 12:55:19 Storage bucket testoffsitestorage: Modify window is 1ns
2015/05/07 12:55:19 Storage bucket testoffsitestorage: Building file list
2015/05/07 12:55:19 Storage bucket testoffsitestorage: Waiting for checks to finish
2015/05/07 12:55:19 testdb.sql.gz: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0, within tolerance 1ns)
2015/05/07 12:55:19 testdb.sql.gz: Unchanged skipping
2015/05/07 12:55:19 mysql.sql.gz: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0, within tolerance 1ns)
2015/05/07 12:55:19 mysql.sql.gz: Unchanged skipping
2015/05/07 12:55:19 tmp.sql.gz: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0, within tolerance 1ns)

2015/05/07 12:55:31 mw.sql.gz: Removing failed copy
2015/05/07 12:55:31 Storage bucket testoffsitestorage: Not deleting files as there were IO errors
